snippet: The federal Equal Employment Opportunity Commission is recommending that the city pay hundreds of millions of dollars in back wages and damages to minorities and women.
abstract: United States Equal Employment Opportunity Commission finds that New York City has discriminated against minorities and women by substantially paying them less than their white male counterparts, and recommends that city pay $246 million in back wages and other damages.
lead_paragraph: The federal Equal Employment Opportunity Commission is recommending that the city pay hundreds of millions of dollars in back wages and damages to minorities and women.

headline.main: New York City Discriminated in Paying Managers, Commission Finds
headline.print_headline: City Discriminated in Paying Managers, Commission Says
